item.title: Powershell Array Fundamentals
item.description: Arrays are a fundamental feature. Arrays make it possible to ingest, manipulate and output true data structures (and not just raw strings). Arrays can contain one or more elements. An element can be a string, an integer, an object, or even another array, and one array can contain any combination of these elements. Create an Array # create an empty array $cities = @() # create an array with items $cities = @('Toronto','Ottawa','Vancouver','Edmonton','Winnipeg') An array has a length propertie which we can use to get the number of elements in the array
